comment: If you don't need any assistance, don't care about your grades until the very end - then fine take him . I do not recommend him for an online course- does not post grades in timely fashion , rarely responds to emails.I am doing great test/quizzes because those grades are instantly posted but I have no idea what my grades are for discussion posts.
His class made me change my major to Psychology.

Was not clear on what he really wanted us to learn from chapters.  Told us to read chapters and write down what we thought was important.  Posted study guides late and they were not helpful at all. He even posted a study guide less than 24 hours before exam.
Hard class for an intro but prof was clear and interesting to listen to.  Grading was mostly fair and extra credit ops were given.

First extam class average 71.  Second exam class average 72.  Lecture not boring, but he is very unclear what he wants us to really focus on.  Lots of info, way too much to only have 3 exam for 1 semester.

Very unclear what he wants us to learn. First exam class average was 71.5 so he bumped up everyone 2 grade points.  In Feb he said he was going to post extra credit.  Now April no extra credit. Test tomorrow just posted study guide today at Noon.  Nice person, but not that good as a professor.

This was a hybrid class so we only met once a week, which is fine with me. I thought he was boring and attendance was not mandatory, but we had weekly quizzes and 3 test. If you look over the power points and read the chapter summary prior to the test, you'll do fine. Easy A (at least for me)

This prof. was easy to listen to and was easy to pay attention in his class.  This is not boring class.  his exams cover too much material.  he does not return emails very well.  He was more concerned that people did not do well on the exam, it was almost like he desired people to fail.  the 1st exam the median was 84 and the second was 73.
This class was simple and Mr. Donaldson explains things very clearly.  He also makes you use application to understand the concepts.

very clear about what he wants you to learn. he presents slides and he also posts them so you dont really need to take notes. one quiz a week but only 5 questions. he is very passionate about his field. overall a great teacher
I had him for Dev Psy so read the book and Powerpoints, do the online quizzes/journals, attend class and you will do good. It helps that he is very ORGANIZED, clear, and helpful.
nice helpful, tests are off bbok and powerpoints, I got an A.

This Doctor is very helpful and understanding of his students and is very clear and easy in lectures. Also, assigns journals and gives quizzes weekly if in hybrid class. Overall pay attention in class, read your book, and study briefly will conclude you with an A

Very nice guy, but it's obvious he is new to the whole teaching thing. It took over a week for him to post grades, even though they were scantrons. Not once did I ever see my discussion grades. I did not have a solid idea as to where my grade stood throughout the class. But, he was a lenient grader apparently because I did get an A.
Justin Donaldson is an amazing professor.  He is maybe the nicest prof I've ever had.  He's patient, open to people's input, understanding, and fair.  Just a wonderful addition to KSU.  5 stars!
